question: Which among the following pairs of Tribes and their Habitat is not correctly matched?
option1: Red Indians - Aborigines of North America
option2: Masai - Cattle herders of South America
answer: Masai - Cattle herders of South America
explanation:
The tribal societies are today found in many parts of the world and they live by activities like hunting, gathering, plant cultivation, animal rearing, fishing, etc.
Masai - Nomadic cattle herders of East Africa. They occupy the interior plateau of the northern part of East Africa in Kenya, northern Tanzania and eastern Uganda.
